tn.text: These are men's names. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:06:23|6:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"70 of Israel's elders" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This is an idiom that means the people were in complete agreement. AT: "together" or "in agreement" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"base of the mountain" or "bottom of the mountain"

tn.ref: Moses took half of the blood and put it into basins
tn.text: Moses collected half of the blood in basins in order to splash it on the people in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:24:07|24:8]]. This would confirm the people's participation in the covenant between the people of Israel and God.

tn.ref: he sprinkled the other half onto the altar
tn.text: Here the altar represents God. This would confirm God's participation in the covenant between God and the people of Israel.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "We will obey everything" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to the blood that Moses had put into the bowls. This can be stated clearly. AT: "Then Moses took the blood that was in the bowls" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These are men's names. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:06:23|6:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This speaks of God as if he had human feet. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: a pavement made of sapphire stone
tn.text: "a pavement made of blue stones called sapphires"
a hard surface for walking or riding
This is a gemstone that is blue in color. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: as clear as the sky itself
tn.text: This is a simile. AT: "as clear as the sky is when there are no clouds" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: God did not lay a hand in anger on the Israelite leaders
tn.text: This means that God did not harm the leaders. AT: "God did not harm the Israelite leaders" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: tablets of stone and the law and commandments
tn.text: God had written the law and commandments on the tablets of stone. This can be stated clearly. AT: "two stone slabs on which I have written all the laws" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"with Joshua who assisted him" or "with Joshua who helped him"
"wait for Joshua and me"
Hur was a man who was a friend of Moses and Aaron. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:17:08|17:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This was the brilliant light of God's presence. AT: "The brilliant light showing God's presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This means the glory of Yahweh was very large and seemed to burn brightly like a fire. AT: "like a big fire burning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: in the eyes of the Israelites
tn.text: Here "eyes" refers to their thoughts about what they saw. AT: "to the Israelites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"40 days and 40 nights" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
